contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{nihongo|'''Namegata'''|行方郡|Namegata-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 40,930 and a [[population density|density]] of 246.08 persons per km². The total area is 166.33 km². The District was dissolved on September 2, 2005 when all three municipalities merged to form the new city of [[Namegata, Ibaraki|Namegata]], effectively turning the district into a city. ==District timeline== *April 1, 2001 - The towns of Itako and [[Ushibori, Ibaraki|Ushibori]] merged to form the city of [[Itako, Ibaraki|Itako]]. *September 2, 2005 - [[Asō, Ibaraki|Asō]], [[Kitaura, Ibaraki|Kitaura]] and [[Tamatsukuri, Ibaraki|Tamatsukuri]] merged to form the city of Namegata. {{Ibaraki}} {{coord missing|Ibaraki Prefecture}} [[Category:Former districts of Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
